plugins.name: Layer Renaming
plugins.description:
Layer Renaming: Streamline Your Workflow with Effortless Layer Management


Revolutionize your Figma workflow with Layer Renaming, the ultimate solution for efficient layer organization. This powerful plugin offers:


1. Selective Layer Renaming: Choose specific layers and modify their names with ease.

2. Time-Based Ordering: Automatically arrange layers based on their creation time for a logical naming sequence.

3. Customizable Naming Patterns: Input a primary layer name and add custom symbols or numbering as desired.

4. One-Click Renaming: Instantly rename multiple layers with a single confirmation, saving you valuable time.


Whether you're working on complex designs or maintaining consistency across projects, Layer Renaming simplifies your process, allowing you to focus on what truly matters - your creative vision.


Boost your productivity today with Layer Renaming - the fast, intuitive, and indispensable tool for every Figma user!




Layer Renaming：輕鬆管理圖層，簡化您的工作流程


革新您的 Figma 工作流程，Layer Renaming 是高效圖層組織的終極解決方案。這個強大的插件提供：


1. 選擇性圖層重命名：輕鬆選擇特定圖層並修改其名稱。

2. 基於時間的排序：根據圖層創建時間自動排列，實現邏輯性的命名順序。

3. 自定義命名模式：輸入主要圖層名稱，並根據需要添加自定義符號或編號。

4. 一鍵重命名：只需一次確認，即可立即重命名多個圖層，節省寶貴時間。


無論您正在處理複雜的設計還是維護跨項目的一致性，Layer Renaming 都能簡化您的流程，讓您專注於真正重要的事 - 您的創意願景。


立即提升您的生產力，使用 Layer Renaming - 每個 Figma 用戶不可或缺的快速、直觀工具！

plugins.name: Coordinate
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for quickly targeting nodes and extracting key positional data (X, Y, width, height) for use in other applications.


_Built using [The DataFace's Figma plugin template](https://github.com/the-dataface/figma-plugin-svelte-vite)_


How-to


1. Prefix desired nodes with a uniform string (e.g. `COORDINATE.` or `#` or `@`).

2. Once the plugin is initialized, enter that string in the search box (the default is `COORDINATE`) and run the command.

3. The positional data will show up below in the plugin's UI as JSON. You can download the results directly using the download button in the top-right corner of the results box.

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.name: African Name Generator
plugins.description:
African Name Generator Plugin


What It Does

The African Name Generator plugin helps you quickly add authentic African names to your designs. You can generate and insert first names, last names, or full names from Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, and Ethiopia.


How to Use It

1. Open the Plugin: Find and launch the African Name Generator plugin in your Figma plugins menu.

2. Select Parameters:

- Country: Choose Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, Ethiopia, Egypt, Senegal, Uganda, Tanzania, Morocco, and Cameroon.

- Gender: Pick male or female.

- Name Type: Select first name, last name, or full name.

3. Generate Name: Click the "Generate Name" button. The name will appear in the plugin.

4. Insert Name:

- Select a text layer in your Figma file.

- Click the "Insert Name" button. The plugin will insert the name into the selected text layer.


Limitations

- Name List: The names come from a fixed list. Not every African name is included.

- Font Support: The plugin uses fonts available in Figma. Ensure the desired font is available.

- Single Text Layer: Insert names into one text layer at a time. Repeat the process for multiple layers.


The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.

accepted.name: Joseph Kalu
accepted.description: I am a fintech and crypto product designer

plugins.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

plugins.name: Bulka
plugins.description:
🥯 Bulka bakes sticky notes from text, in bulk.

  1. Run Bulka
  2. Type, paste, or select text on board
  3. Pick your sticky note color
  4. Smash the button
  5. Each line becomes a separate sticky note


🤍 Creator's favorite use case: Copy a column from a spreadsheet and add it as multiple sticky notes at once. Feels damn good.


💡 Pro tip: Select text on the board, then run the plugin to automatically paste text into Bulka.


🇺🇦 Fun fact: Bulka (бу́лка) is a bread bun in Ukrainian. By sheer coincidence, the English word bulk is part of it. 😉

plugins.name: Variables Inspector
plugins.description:
Variables Inspector is a powerful tool for design system creators and UI designers working with complex interfaces. It helps analyze, export, and import tokens while detecting issues in variables and components.


Features:


  1. Comprehensive Token and Component Statistics – collections, modes, linked components, auto-layouts, and more.
  2. Token Analysis – identifies unlinked elements (padding, border, fill, grid) and helps fix them.
  3. Export & Import Variables – save JSON files and use them across different Figma projects.
  4. Design System Optimization – analyze text styles, duplicates, grids, and used fonts.


Export & Import Variables – The Core Feature of the Plugin


The “Export & Import Variables” function is designed to simplify the management of design tokens and variables within Figma, ensuring seamless collaboration, consistency, and reusability across different projects and files.


Why is this feature important?


Figma’s variables and design tokens are essential for maintaining scalability and uniformity in design systems. However, manually transferring or updating them between files can be a tedious and error-prone task. This feature allows users to effortlessly export all variable data to a JSON file and import it into another Figma file, enabling a smooth, automated workflow for design teams.


Exporting Variables (Save & Share Your Tokens)


The Export Variables functionality lets you save all your Figma design tokens and variables in a structured JSON format. This ensures that all color, spacing, typography, effects, and other tokens remain intact when shared across projects.


Steps:


  1. Click the “Export Variables” button in the plugin interface.
  2. The plugin will collect all existing variable collections, modes, and tokens in the current Figma file.
  3. A structured JSON file is generated and downloaded automatically.
  4. You can now store, share, or use this file in other projects or with your team.


Import Variables (seamless integration into any file with the same token collections but different values)


The Import Variables feature allows users to load and apply a previously saved JSON file containing variables. This ensures that design teams can quickly synchronize tokens between multiple files without manually recreating them.


Steps:


  1. Click on the “Import Variables” button.
  2. Upload a previously exported JSON file.
  3. The plugin will read the token data and match it with the current Figma document.
  4. All variable collections, tokens, and values are automatically applied.
  5. Your design system remains consistent without manual effort.


Key Benefits:


  1. Instant Transfer – Move variables between files effortlessly.
  2. Design Consistency – Maintain token integrity across projects.
  3. Backup & Versioning – Save and restore previous variable states.
  4. Team Collaboration – Easily share tokens with other designers or developers.
  5. Cross-Project Compatibility – Use the same token library in different files.


This feature is essential for design teams working on large-scale design systems or UI component libraries where variable consistency is crucial. Whether you’re a UI/UX designer, developer, or design system manager, the Export & Import Variables feature will save you time and effort in maintaining a well-structured, scalable design framework.


Optimize your design system and simplify token management with Variables Inspector!


👉🏻 Behance

👉🏻 Dribbble

✉️ Mail me

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.name: Layer Manager
plugins.description:
Layer Manager is designed to improve your workflow by providing quick access to important layer management functions. 


This plugin focuses on three primary operations: listing layers, controlling layer visibility, and renaming layers. 


Getting Started

  1. Open your Figma design file.
  2. Select the layers or frames you want to manage.
  3. Search for the Layer Manager plugin from the Figma plugin menu.
  4. Launch the plugin. 


Basic Operations

Viewing Layers:

After launching the plugin with your desired layers or frames selected, you'll see a list of all the layers within your selection.


Toggling Layer Visibility

Individual Layers:

  1. Find the layer you want to toggle in the list.
  2. Click the visibility icon next to the layer name to show or hide it.
  3. The change will be immediately reflected in your Figma design.

All Layers:

  1. Use the "Hide all" button to hide all layers in the list at once.
  2. Use the "Show all" button to make all layers in the list visible.


Renaming Layers:

  1. Locate the layer you want to rename in the list.
  2. Click on the layer name to enter edit mode.
  3. Type the new name for the layer.
  4. Press Enter or click outside the input field to confirm the new name.


Refreshing the Layer List:

If you make changes to your selection in the Figma file while the plugin is open:

  1. Click the "Refresh layers" button in the plugin interface.
  2. The layer list will update to reflect your current selection in the Figma document.


Searching Layers:

  1. Click on the search bar at the top of the layer list in the plugin interface and type in your search term. This could be: a layer name or a layer type (e.g., "rectangle," "text," or "group").
  2. As you type, the layer list would dynamically update to show only the layers that match your search criteria.
  3. To clear the search and see all layers again, simply delete your search term.


Tips for Efficient Use

  1. Start with a focused selection in your Figma file to manage specific groups of layers more effectively.
  2. Use the bulk hide/show actions to quickly toggle visibility for comparing different versions of your design.
  3. Regularly refresh the layer list if you're making changes in your Figma file while the plugin is open.
  4. Rename layers directly from the plugin to maintain consistent naming conventions without switching contexts.
plugins.tagline: A better way to view, hide, and rename your design layers.

102092.name: Layer Manager
102092.description:
Layer Manager is designed to improve your workflow by providing quick access to important layer management functions. 


This plugin focuses on three primary operations: listing layers, controlling layer visibility, and renaming layers. 


Getting Started

  1. Open your Figma design file.
  2. Select the layers or frames you want to manage.
  3. Search for the Layer Manager plugin from the Figma plugin menu.
  4. Launch the plugin. 


Basic Operations

Viewing Layers:

After launching the plugin with your desired layers or frames selected, you'll see a list of all the layers within your selection.


Toggling Layer Visibility

Individual Layers:

  1. Find the layer you want to toggle in the list.
  2. Click the visibility icon next to the layer name to show or hide it.
  3. The change will be immediately reflected in your Figma design.

All Layers:

  1. Use the "Hide all" button to hide all layers in the list at once.
  2. Use the "Show all" button to make all layers in the list visible.


Renaming Layers:

  1. Locate the layer you want to rename in the list.
  2. Click on the layer name to enter edit mode.
  3. Type the new name for the layer.
  4. Press Enter or click outside the input field to confirm the new name.


Refreshing the Layer List:

If you make changes to your selection in the Figma file while the plugin is open:

  1. Click the "Refresh layers" button in the plugin interface.
  2. The layer list will update to reflect your current selection in the Figma document.


Searching Layers:

  1. Click on the search bar at the top of the layer list in the plugin interface and type in your search term. This could be: a layer name or a layer type (e.g., "rectangle," "text," or "group").
  2. As you type, the layer list would dynamically update to show only the layers that match your search criteria.
  3. To clear the search and see all layers again, simply delete your search term.


Tips for Efficient Use

  1. Start with a focused selection in your Figma file to manage specific groups of layers more effectively.
  2. Use the bulk hide/show actions to quickly toggle visibility for comparing different versions of your design.
  3. Regularly refresh the layer list if you're making changes in your Figma file while the plugin is open.

plugins.name: Path Arrows
plugins.description:
Easily create clear visual connections between objects in your interface using arrows — fast, simple, and without any manual work. This plugin is perfect for showcasing screen transitions, button interactions, and other UI element relationships.


Here’s how it works:


1. Select the first object (the starting point of the arrow).

2. Then select the second object (the destination).

3. Choose the sides for connection (e.g., left to right or top to bottom).

4. Click the button — the plugin will automatically draw a clean arrow between the two.


It’s a quick and intuitive way to map out user flows, demonstrate interactions, or organize your layout visually


This is the MVP version — more updates are on the way. Your feedback means a lot!

plugins.name: FlowConnect - Figjam Connectors in Figma
plugins.description:
FlowConnect: Connectors that are smart and seamless


FlowConnect brings Figjam-style connectors to Figma, making it easy to link frames and create flows. With smart positioning that automatically adjusts when you move elements, customizable arrow styles, and simple text labels, you can quickly create clean user flows and sitemaps. Connect your frames with just a few clicks and let FlowConnect handle the rest.


Key Features :


✦ Figjam-style connectors: Create connections between frames with real-time visual feedback

✦ Smart positioning: Connectors find the best connection points and auto-reroute when frames move

✦ Advanced styling options: Customize line types, stroke weights, dash patterns, and opacity

✦ Text labels: Add descriptive text to your connections that update automatically

✦ Live preview: See how your connections will look before you create them

✦ Multiple arrow styles: Choose from lines, triangles, diamonds, and circles for both connector ends

✦ Offset controls: Fine-tune connection points for perfect placement along frame edges


Premium Features :


✦ Custom Color Connectors

✦ Shapes - Future

✦ Set Presets

✦ More on the Roadmap.


How to use :

  1. Connecter is Pre copied already, You can just Ctrl/Cmd + V in you canvas to get started, If no press the copy button on top and paste them in canvas [One time Thing].
  2. Select any two objects and click Link objects to connect them using a connector styled according to your preferences.
plugins.tagline: Connectors that are smart and seamless

plugins.name: WCAG Line Length
plugins.description:
Make your text more accessible with automatic line length optimization.


This plugin helps you comply with WCAG 2.2 Success Criterion 1.4.8, which recommends limiting line lengths to 80 characters or less. Long lines of text can be difficult to read and navigate, especially for users with cognitive disabilities or visual impairments.


📐 Key features:

  1. Check text elements against WCAG guidelines
  2. Automatically fix line lengths by adding strategic line breaks
  3. Works with any text layer or text box
  4. Supports multiple text selections
  5. Preserves your original text styling


💬 How to use:

  1. Select any text layers you want to check
  2. Click "Check Selection" to identify issues
  3. Click "Fix" to automatically adjust line lengths


Perfect for:

  1. UX/UI designers
  2. Accessibility specialists
  3. Content designers
  4. Anyone creating accessible digital experiences


Stay compliant with accessibility standards while maintaining clean, readable designs.
plugins.tagline: "Make your designs accessible by optimizing text line lengths to WCAG standards"

plugins.name: Multi-Link Copy
plugins.description:
Multi-Link Copy


Multi-Link Copy is designed to streamline the process of copying multiple frame or component links at once. If you're working on a large-scale design project, you may need to share or document the locations of multiple frames or components within a your file.


Instead of manually copying each link one by one, this plugin allows you to select multiple components or frames and generate their links in bulk. The links are copied to your clipboard in separate lines, making it easy to paste them into a spreadsheet, text file, or any document where you need to store or share those links.


What the Plugin Does:


Batch Copying of Links:

  1. The plugin generates URLs for selected components or frames within the current Figma file.
  2. Each link is a direct reference to the specific node (frame or component) inside the Figma file.
  3. These links are copied to your clipboard and can be pasted into any document, where each URL will appear on its own line in the order of your layer hierarchy in your Figma file (top layers first).


Use Case:

  1. When you need to share links to multiple frames or components in one go, especially for documentation, design reviews, developer hand-offs, or tracking design updates.
  2. Useful for project managers, designers, and developers who need quick access to the location of specific elements within a Figma file.


---


How to Use the Plugin:


1. Enter Figma File URL

  1. After launching the plugin, you will be prompted to enter the URL of your Figma file.
  2. This is required to extract the file key that’s necessary for generating URLs for the selected frames or components.
  3. This data is used temporarily by the plugin and never saved, read, or accessed by anyone.
  4. To get the URL, open the Figma file in your browser and copy the link from the address bar. It should look something like: https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/Your-File-Name.


2. Selecting Elements

  1. Select the components, frames, or any other nodes you want to generate links for.


3. Copy Links

  1. Click "Copy Links" and a notification will appear confirming how many links were copied.
  2. The links are already copied to your clipboard, formatted one per line.


4. Paste Links

  1. Go to any document where you want to paste the links (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, Notion, Slack, etc.).
  2. Each link will populate a new line or row in the document in the order of your layers in Figma (top layers first).


5. Celebrate 🎉


---


What You Can Expect:


Fast Bulk Link Generation: Select as many frames or components as needed, and the plugin will generate URLs for all selected items instantly.


Easy Copy and Paste: Once the plugin runs, the links are automatically copied to the clipboard. You don’t need to open a separate window or click additional buttons. Simply paste the links wherever needed.


---


Example Output


After running the plugin, if you've selected 3 components, pasting into a document will give something like this:


https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=123:456

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=789:1011

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=112:1314


Each URL points directly to the specific frame or component within the Figma file.


---


Limitations:


The plugin needs the Figma file URL to extract the fileKey, which is a unique identifier for your Figma file. The fileKey allows it to accurately generate direct links to the frames or components you select.


The URL is only used temporarily to retrieve this key, ensuring privacy and security. The plugin does not store any information. Keep in mind, only users with access to your files can view or use the generated links.


About fileKeys: A fileKey is part of the URL that uniquely identifies each Figma file. It's essential for referencing the correct file when generating links for components or frames. To understand more about how fileKeys work and where they are located in your Figma URL, you can visit Figma's documentation here.
plugins.tagline: Batch copy mutliple frame links at a time

plugins.name: Mongolian Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mongolian Brothers.


Нэмэлт сайжруулалт хүсэлтийн тухай коммент хэсэгт үлдээгээрэй. 😎


Хялбар аргаар текст болон өгүүлбэр үүсгэгч.

plugins.name: Clickma: ClickUp to Figma Sync
plugins.description:
Clickma eliminates rework and duplication by keeping design and project documentation seamlessly aligned in one unified workflow. It ties relevant ClickUp tickets directly to the Figma sections referenced, so Designers, Developers, Product Managers, and QAs can easily find what they need. See a video demo here.


Some key features include:

  1. Ticket import: Display Clickup Tickets in your Figma canvas.
  2. Jump to ticket: See all imported tickets in a list and jump to their location in your figma file.
  3. Search ticket in list view: Basic users can search by title and Clickup ID. Premium users can also search by Clickup status or assignee.
  4. DevMode Compatible: DevMode users can jump to ticket and see the list view.
  5. Sync tickets: Basic users can sync tickets individually, while Premium users can bulk sync tickets with just 1-click.
  6. Ticket link (premium): Open your tickets in your browser from list view, DevMode or the tickets you import.
  7. Edit tickets (premium): Edit ticket title, status and description within Figma and sync back to ClickUp.


Check more details our website clickma.tech


We are in active development, if you have suggestions for improvement, feedback or need help please contact us at support@clickma.tech

plugins.name: Token Code -  (Css, Tailwind, Typescript, Shopify, Swift, Android)
plugins.description:
This app takes your Figma design tokens, such as color, typography, effect, and spacing, and generates code outputs in over 10 different formats, including CSS, SCSS, Tailwind, TypeScript, Shopify Liquid, Swift, and more. Additionally, it allows you to export Local Styles definitions as CSS. Designed to streamline your design-to-code workflow, it’s an essential tool for designers and developers alike.


How Does It Work?

1.Select either Local Variables or Local Styles to begin.

2.Choose the tokens you want to generate code for.

3.Pick your desired output format (e.g., CSS, Tailwind).

4.Hit the Copy button to get your code.


That’s it! Transforming your tokens into ready-to-use code is now just a few clicks away.


Additional Highlights

•User-Friendly: The simple interface makes it easy for anyone to use, regardless of their experience level.

•Broad Format Support: With over 10 output formats, it seamlessly integrates into any workflow or technology stack.

•Time-Saving: Quickly bridge the gap between design and development, saving you hours of manual work.


This app is the perfect bridge between design and code. Take your design tokens to development with just one click and supercharge your workflow! 🚀



This app is completely free! It’s designed to make your workflow faster and easier. If you find it helpful, feel free to leave a review, like, or share it with others.

If you encounter any issues, you can reach out to me directly via X ❤️
plugins.tagline: Turn Your Design Tokens into Ready-to-Use Code Across 10+ Formats with One Click!

plugins.name: Nong’s Handoff Tools
plugins.description:
Usage:

  1. Connect Pages: Select two Frames that need to be linked. In the plugin panel, choose the direction for the outgoing lines of the two Frames, then click the “Link” button to create the connection.
  2. Add Text Annotations: Select the element that needs an annotation. Click the button in the plugin panel to generate a number and text annotation.
  3. Draw Flowchart: Click the button to generate an element individually. Alternatively, select an existing element and then click the button to connect it to the selected element.
  4. Change Background Color: Click the “Page” button to change the color of the page. Select a Section and click the “Section” button to change the Section’s color. Click the “Area” button to directly generate a Frame for a separate Area.



使用方式：

  1. 连接页面：选择两个需要连线的Frame，在插件面板上选择两个Frame 出线的方向，点击Link按钮，即可连线。
  2. 添加文字备注：选择需要备注的元素，在插件面板上点击按钮，即可生成序号和文字。
  3. 绘制流程图：单独点击按钮可单独生成元素。也可先选择某个元素，再点击按钮，则会连接到选择的元素上。
  4. 背景色更改：直接点击Page按钮会更改Page的颜色。选择Section，点击Section按钮，则会修改Section颜色。点击Area按钮，会直接生成一个单独Area的Frame。

plugins.name: Table text plugin
plugins.description:
Description

The Table text plugin allows designers to streamline the process of populating table components in Figma with comma-delimited data. Users can paste their data directly into the plugin’s interface, and the plugin will parse and populate the corresponding text layers in table cells. If additional rows are required, the plugin dynamically generates them based on the input data, ensuring a seamless fit within the existing table structure.


Key features

  1. Data input: Easily paste comma-delimited data into the provided text area. Supports handling data with embedded commas by using double quotes (" ") as delimiters.
  2. Dynamic row creation: Automatically generates new rows if the input data exceeds the existing table row count in Figma.
  3. Header matching: Maps data headers to corresponding Figma table cells based on their names, ensuring precise data alignment.
  4. Text layer updates: Identifies text layers named text within table cells and updates their content with the provided data.
  5. Guided setup: Includes a detailed Readme section to help users format data correctly and prepare their Figma file for efficient use of the plugin.


Best practices

  1. Prepare data in tools like Google Sheets and export it to a comma-delimited format.
  2. Ensure table headers in Figma match the column names in the data for accurate mapping.
  3. Define rows as local components in Figma and name them sequentially (e.g., Row 1, Row 2).


How to videos

I've created a series of video walkthrough to accompany the Figma playground file to highlight how the plugin works and how best to utilise it.

  1. Introduction
  2. Walkthrough
  3. Demo


Use the playground file to play with the capabilities of the plugin, as shown in the videos above.


This plugin simplifies data handling for table-based designs, saving time and ensuring consistency in Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform CSV data into Figma table rows

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Creator
plugins.description:
Typography Style Guide Creator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers streamline their typography workflow by automatically generating text styles from existing designs. Stop manually recreating text styles and let this plugin do the heavy lifting.

With Typography Style Guide Creator, you can transform any frame containing text elements into a complete typography system that's integrated directly into your Figma styles. Simply select a frame with your text designs, run the plugin, and watch as your typography system comes to life.

Key Features


Instant Style Generation: Convert manually created text elements into reusable Figma text styles with one click

Smart Name Recognition: Uses your text layer names as style names for better organization

Duplicate Detection: Intelligently identifies and merges duplicate styles to keep your design system clean

Visual Style Preview: See all created styles in an intuitive interface before applying them

Seamless Integration: Styles are added directly to your Figma document's style library


How It Works


Select a Frame: Choose any frame containing your text elements

Name Your Layers: Ensure text layers have descriptive names (e.g., "Heading/H1", "Body/Regular")

Run the Plugin: Click "Create Styles" to generate your typography system

Done!: Your text styles are now available in your Figma document


Perfect For


Design teams establishing consistent typography systems

Designers converting existing designs into organized style guides

Design system maintainers looking to formalize typography rules

Anyone who wants to save time on manual style creation


Save Hours of Design Work

Typography Style Guide Creator eliminates the tedious process of manually creating and managing text styles. What would normally take hours can now be done in seconds, allowing you to focus on what matters most—designing great experiences.
plugins.tagline: Turn your text designs into organized typography styles with a single click

plugins.name: Frame Inspector
plugins.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.
